dt: {bc}ability to discern inner qualities and relationships {bc}{sx|insight||}

dt.t: challenges what has become accepted {wi}wisdom{/wi} among many historians

dt: {bc}a wise attitude, belief, or course of action
{bc}the teachings of the ancient wise men

pt: {sc}sense{/sc} {sc}common sense{/sc} {sc}judgment{/sc} {sc}wisdom{/sc} mean ability to reach intelligent conclusions. {sc}sense{/sc} implies a reliable ability to judge and decide with soundness, prudence, and intelligence.
{sc}common sense{/sc} suggests an average degree of such ability without sophistication or special knowledge.
{sc}judgment{/sc} implies sense tempered and refined by experience, training, and maturity.

pt.t: they relied on her {it}judgment{/it} for guidance

pt: {sc}wisdom{/sc} implies sense and judgment far above average.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}wīsdōm{/it}, from {it}wīs{/it} wise
shortdef: ability to discern inner qualities and relationships : insight

dt: {bc}a didactic book included in the Roman Catholic canon of the Old Testament and corresponding to the Wisdom of Solomon in the Protestant Apocrypha {dx}see {dxt|Bible Table|bible|table}{/dx}

shortdef: a didactic book included in the Roman Catholic canon of the Old Testament and corresponding to the Wisdom of Solomon in the Protestant Apocrypha

dt: {bc}a didactic book included in the Protestant Apocrypha {dx}see {dxt|Bible Table|bible|table}{/dx}

shortdef: a didactic book included in the Protestant Apocrypha

dt: {bc}the third molar that is the last tooth to erupt on each side of the upper and lower jaws in humans

et: from being cut usually in the late teens
shortdef: the third molar that is the last tooth to erupt on each side of the upper and lower jaws in humans

dt: {bc}the generally accepted belief, opinion, judgment, or prediction about a particular matter

shortdef: the generally accepted belief, opinion, judgment, or prediction about a particular matter

dt: used in an ironic way to say that someone has made a foolish choice or decision

dt.t: He decided, {it}in his infinite wisdom{/it}, that it would be better to sell the house than to keep it.

shortdef: —used in an ironic way to say that someone has made a foolish choice or decision

dt.t: He offered some {it}pearls of wisdom{/it} about raising children.
A crowd of reporters gathered around the coach after the game to hear him dispense his usual {it}pearls of wisdom{/it}.

shortdef: a wise word or statement —often humorous
